Crack works. Thanks THETA! I was actually going to buy this game, but I went down to EB Games and Gamestop and neither were selling it! They both informed me that they rarely sell PC games in the store anymore (I hadn't been to either store in a very long time). And developers wonder why people pirate! Why should I be punished to have to buy a copy online and get it shipped to me (I like physical boxed copies of the few games I actually buy, I bought Dragon Age: Origins in store boxed) and have to wait when PS3 and XBOX owners can go to the same store I was in and pickup their copy no problem? Thanks THETA for helping me play this amazing game where traditional methods have failed. Now I can play offline too on my plane rides!

@moldybudz
EB games and Gamestop haven't been selling PC games for quite some time. If they do, its usually a very very, VERY limited selection. They never sold many PC games because their prices are too expensive and they never have any sales going on. Also, buying from an online store (steam, amazon, etc) then downloading the game directly to your PC has become pretty much a mainstream thing these days because its usually pretty cheap and you don't have to worry about hoarding dvds anymore.
